update.description: After an entity was deleted, visuals were not responding to calls to `Link::SetVisualPose()` in gzclient. This pull request introduces a hack to fix this issue: GLWidget creates a publisher for ~/visual to always be connected to this topic. The publisher is never used to publish any message. It is created solely to maintain an active connection with the server for this topic.
update.title: Fix issue with visuals in gzclient after an entity gets deleted

pull_request.title: Fix issue with visuals in gzclient after an entity gets deleted

pullrequest.title: Fix issue with visuals in gzclient after an entity gets deleted

content.html:
Hi @ocrave , thanks for the pull request! I'm wondering if there is a way to write a test for this.

I'm trying to understand the problem, I think you're suggesting that when an entity is deleted and its visPub is destroyed, rendering::Scene's visSub is destroyed/unsubscribed? Or is it not unsubscribed, but still stops receiving messages?

I did a quick test to see if it was being unsubscribed and it looks like it isn't. What I did:

  1. Added print outs to the subscriber:

    diff -r 40c062da7dcc gazebo/transport/Subscriber.cc
--- a/gazebo/transport/Subscriber.cc  Tue Jul 25 14:09:17 2017 -0700
+++ b/gazebo/transport/Subscriber.cc  Wed Jul 26 11:36:25 2017 -0700
@@ -40,6 +40,7 @@
 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
 Subscriber::~Subscriber()
 {
+gzdbg << "Destroy " << this->topic << std::endl;
   this->Unsubscribe();
   this->node.reset();
 }
@@ -53,6 +54,7 @@
 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
 void Subscriber::Unsubscribe() const
 {
+gzdbg << "Unsub " << this->topic << std::endl;
   if (this->node)
   {
     TopicManager::Instance()->Unsubscribe(this->topic, this->node);

  2. Started the blank world:

    gazebo --verbose worlds/blank.world

  3. Checked that there is a subscriber but no publisher yet:

    gz topic -i /gazebo/default/visual

  4. Then inserted a box and checked that there is now a publisher

  5. Deleted the box, the print outs don't show up and I can verify from the command line that there is still a subscriber, but no more publisher
